title: Rugby World Cup 2019 live scores, updates: Australia vs Georgia
text:
Australia has secured a bonus point win over Georgia in a game that has done little to boost belief that the Wallabies can beat England in the quarter-finals.

In wet and wild conditions in in Shizuoka as super typhoon Hagibis approaches Japan, the Wallabies only cemented the win over Georgia with two late tries.

Until Jack Dempsey’s back-breaking try in the 75th minute, Georgia kept in touch with the Wallabies, at times overpowering the men in gold at the coal face.

However, the superior Wallabies set-piece again covered up the cracks in the rest of the Wallabies performance.

The win means the Wallabies will go through to face England in a monster quarter-final against England.

The biggest concern for the Wallabies heading into the showdown with England is the fitness of star fullback Kurtley Beale who failed a concussion test early in the first half.

The Wallabies’ discipline is also going to keep coach Michael Cheika up at night heading into the England battle after another Wallaby – Isi Naisarani – was sent to the sin bin for a high tackle.

Wallabies captain David Pocock said after the game his team will take a moment to celebrate the win before turning their focus to England.

“It’ll be a big week, we all know we need to go up a gear,” Pocock said.

“We’ll enjoy this one. Rob Simmons played his 100th (Test) which was an amazing achievement, so we’ll celebrate that and then we’ll look to next week.”
